a

Symmetry transformations used to generate equivalent atoms: For 1: #1 -x + 3/2, -y + 1/2, -z + 2; #2 -x + 2, -y + 1, -z + 2; #3 x, -y + 1, z + 1/2; #4 x - 1/2, y - 1/2, z; #5 -x + 3/2, y - 1/2, -z + 3/2; #6 x + 1/2, -y + 3/2, z + 1/2; #7 x + 1/2, y + 1/2, z. For 2: #1 -x + 2, y, -z + 3/2; #2 x - 1/2, -y + 1/2, z + 1/2; #3 x - 1/2, -y + 1/2, z - 1/2; #4 -x + 2, y, -z + 5/2; #5 -x + 3/2, -y + 1/2, -z + 2. For 3: #1 -x + 1/4, y + 1/4, z + 1/4; #2 x + 1/4, -y + 1/4, z + 1/4; #3 x - 1/4, -y + 1/4, z + 3/4. For 4: #1 x + 1, y, z; #2 x, y + 1, z - 1; #3 -x, -y + 1, -z; #4 -x + 1, -y + 1, -z + 1.

elements.content: The layered structure of 4 constructed by metal octahedra (blue polyhedra), L (gold and violet sticks).The simplified network of 4. Mn and L ligands are simplified into blue, and gold nodes, respectively, and the Mn–L bonds are shown in two-colored sticks. 2-Connected bibp ligands are transformed into edges (Mn–Mn, blue sticks) during simplification.
elements.clean_text:
The layered structure of 4 constructed by metal octahedra (blue polyhedra), L (gold and violet sticks).

The simplified network of 4. Mn and L ligands are simplified into blue, and gold nodes, respectively, and the Mn-L bonds are shown in two-colored sticks. 2-Connected bibp ligands are transformed into edges (Mn-Mn, blue sticks) during simplification.

elements.content: Fig. 10 The simplified network of 4. Mn and L ligands are simplified into blue, and gold nodes, respectively, and the Mn–L bonds are shown in two-colored sticks. 2-Connected bibp ligands are transformed into edges (Mn–Mn, blue sticks) during simplification.
elements.clean_text: Fig. 10  The simplified network of 4. Mn and L ligands are simplified into blue, and gold nodes, respectively, and the Mn-L bonds are shown in two-colored sticks. 2-Connected bibp ligands are transformed into edges (Mn-Mn, blue sticks) during simplification.
